bibl.title: Letter from Philotas to His Brother Dioscourides: Philotas, a Black Sheep in a High-Class Family?
Papyrological Texts in Honor of Roger S. Bagnall

bibl.note: Provenance unknown, II BCE, July - early September. A certain Philotas admits to have run off (from the police most likely) and to be a renegade now.
bibl.seg: Cornelia Römer, Letter from Philotas to His Brother Dioscourides: Philotas, a Black Sheep in a High-Class Family?

Rodney Ast, Hélène Cuvigny, Todd M. Hickey & Julia Lougovaya (edd.), Papyrological Texts in Honor of Roger S. Bagnall = American Studies in Papyrology. 53 (Durham, North Carolina, 2013) pp. 291-294, 2 figg.
Provenance unknown, II BCE, July - early September. A certain Philotas admits to have run off (from the police most likely) and to be a renegade now.
